intro: Justicia salma-margaritae, commonly known as the Salma-Margarita justicia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
